results.content: I just completed the Front-End portion of the course so far can honestly say I have learned very valuable information, and feel very confident in my HTML and CSS.  Flip is a great instructor and I'm happy that he introduced me to the Brackets text editor and some of the amazing features, I'm looking forward to completing the course over this weekend and I strongly recommend that this course as a supplement to a web development course such as the Web Dev Bootcamp to really review. This is solid material.

results.content: This course moves to fast for me to watch and follow along at the same time. I constantly find my self going back and even at 75% of the speed it goes too fast. I understand you are a fast coder but remember you are teaching a class to people who are very new to this.

response.content:
Hello Justin,

Thank you for the review. I understand you - but - when teaching thousands of students online, you simply cannot fulfill everyone's requests and pace preferences. 

This is why I had to choose an ideal teaching pace and after a lot of testing, I decided to go with the current pace that the course is offering.

Very little reviews (around 0.3% to 0.5%) stated that they've found the pace to be too quick which makes me think that I'm on the right track.

If I was teaching you, as a student, with a slower pace than this, I believe that much more than 0.5% of the students would be complaining that the pace is too SLOW for them.

So, I had to hit some "golden mean" with my pacing, if you know what I mean. However, I hope that some of my other courses will live up to your expectations and hopefully score higher than a 3-star review.

Thanks,
Filip
response.content_html:
Hello Justin,

Thank you for the review. I understand you - but - when teaching thousands of students online, you simply cannot fulfill everyone's requests and pace preferences.

This is why I had to choose an ideal teaching pace and after a lot of testing, I decided to go with the current pace that the course is offering.

Very little reviews (around 0.3% to 0.5%) stated that they've found the pace to be too quick which makes me think that I'm on the right track.

If I was teaching you, as a student, with a slower pace than this, I believe that much more than 0.5% of the students would be complaining that the pace is too SLOW for them.

So, I had to hit some "golden mean" with my pacing, if you know what I mean. However, I hope that some of my other courses will live up to your expectations and hopefully score higher than a 3-star review.

Thanks,
Filip

results.content:
I have been making websites since I was 14 years old. I first used "adobe flash" to make websites, not really the professional way to do things and flash has been decremented.
  
I wish I knew how to make real and professional way of making websites, and this course does exactly that.

This course is a MUST and a good starting point for anyone that wants to make professional websites from pure scratch.
Most importantly this course is a "must" for professional back-end web developers who designs complex websites such as logistics and eCommerce and needs to make their front end. 
You can't rely and use third party premade websites such as "wix" to make custom complex websites.

I have been playing around with adobe dreamwear for more than a decade, it's completely rubbish and I never liked it. You can't be lazy as a professional web developer, you need to get dirty with pure code either in HTML, JAVASCRIPT, PHP, SQL etc and etc.
This courses teaches you how to make a professional website using pure code mostly using HTML CSS AND JAVASCRIPT but at an introductory level which will satisfy a hardcore programmer.
I was very pleased with the effort of the making of this course, it's not too basic or overly complicated which can get irrelevant.

The author does not wastes your time, gets straight to the point and teaches you whats really important. I didn't get into any issues while following the course, everything was placed neatly, mindfully and best of all everything was relevant.

results.content:
This course has been edited enough where some things don't make sense. I just finished 4-30, and the html
     <div class="inline images"> 
caused some major problems for me. 
.images was referenced earlier, and had a float of right, which made the icon images sit outside the container. I removed images, and all is well.

Earlier in the course, there is no real explanation on how the code he says to do is able to mask the phone image and the background image.



I finished the course. A lot of it was review for me, and that is still valuable.
However, I did not appreciate a few things:
-Freeze framing and putting in text explanations to cover mistakes. But I do get it. I have a YT channel with lots of videos too.
-Bonus lectures not finished. However, It does provide a challenge for me to finish what we started.
-Your video about positioning says that the parent needs to be relative, and children set to absolute. By that logic, .imgs should have been relative.
I had to go back and rewatch what you actually did in order to determine that .imgs was still set to abs.
-There was a lot of video padding. Introducing, and welcoming.... blah blah blah. Get to the meat!

Outside of that, I enjoyed the course. It's nice to have another process to learn from.
results.content_html:
This course has been edited enough where some things don't make sense. I just finished 4-30, and the html


caused some major problems for me.
.images was referenced earlier, and had a float of right, which made the icon images sit outside the container. I removed images, and all is well.

Earlier in the course, there is no real explanation on how the code he says to do is able to mask the phone image and the background image.

I finished the course. A lot of it was review for me, and that is still valuable.
However, I did not appreciate a few things:
-Freeze framing and putting in text explanations to cover mistakes. But I do get it. I have a YT channel with lots of videos too.
-Bonus lectures not finished. However, It does provide a challenge for me to finish what we started.
-Your video about positioning says that the parent needs to be relative, and children set to absolute. By that logic, .imgs should have been relative.
I had to go back and rewatch what you actually did in order to determine that .imgs was still set to abs.
-There was a lot of video padding. Introducing, and welcoming.... blah blah blah. Get to the meat!

Outside of that, I enjoyed the course. It's nice to have another process to learn from.

results.content:
This course is upper good if you want to know how front-end developer works with UI designer. I'm personally a backend software developer and it has been a mystery for me that how developers work together with a designer. This course solved my long term question. Now I know that developer would convert PSD into html and css and form the sample website.
I think this course is suitable for new front-end developers and some designers. And you would learn the skill of converting the design into a real website.
Overall, I would give this course 96/100 for rating and my recommendation.

results.content: Very good course on PSD to HTML. Filip clearly knows his stuff. Only improvement would be to go more in-depth with the design phase of PSD and the relation between PSD designs and their adaptations to HTML&CSS. Very good course though.

results.content:
I just finished the course and it was pretty good. Even if you are already intermediate, you will probably learn some techniques and good practices here that will stick with you through your career. 

The instructor supplies a PSD file for us to convert to HTML & CSS with a little jQuery. He also provide additional PSD designs so you can practice on your own afterwards which is a good idea since you will want to review your notes.

I didn't really get stuck anywhere although I did have a couple of curiosities which I posted in the Q&A and Filip was responsive. That's really important for these courses in my opinion.

This is easily digestible and I was able to get through in a little over a week. I'll probably spend a bit more time this week going over my notes while everything is fresh in my mind. 

Enjoy the course!

results.content:
Aaaaa!  Clown!

First the bad stuff:

- Section 1 is about how to take the course (the actual course starts in section 3).
- Section 1 contains more self-promotion than is necessary.
- There's a navigation glitch at the 1/8.  The video ends, then the audio repeats.
- Scary clown and inbred farmer.


The rest:

On occasion you tell that Filip's first language is not English, but overall his English is quite good, so no problems there.

I gave the course 4 stars because the course does as advertised.  The instructor converts a PSD to an HTML5 animated responsive website, and it's quite an interesting process.  I learned a lot.

My only quibble would be including a 3rd party css library for the animations.  I think this could have been avoided.

Photoshop would be highly recommended, but I managed to get by in the gimp.
results.content_html:
Aaaaa! Clown!

First the bad stuff:

- Section 1 is about how to take the course (the actual course starts in section 3).
- Section 1 contains more self-promotion than is necessary.
- There's a navigation glitch at the 1/8. The video ends, then the audio repeats.
- Scary clown and inbred farmer.

The rest:

On occasion you tell that Filip's first language is not English, but overall his English is quite good, so no problems there.

I gave the course 4 stars because the course does as advertised. The instructor converts a PSD to an HTML5 animated responsive website, and it's quite an interesting process. I learned a lot.

My only quibble would be including a 3rd party css library for the animations. I think this could have been avoided.

Photoshop would be highly recommended, but I managed to get by in the gimp.

results.content: A well-structured course that takes you from mockup to functioning website quite easily (for those with basic / limited knowledge of web development). Even though I'm an experienced designer-developer there were still new tips I picked up from the course. The extra/sample psd projects are a cool bonus and are sure to keep you creatively challenged and inspired after the course.

results.content:
The course started really good aside from the repetitive intro music that is really loud I was able to be patient with it, the problem started on lecture 23 when the instructor goes super fast doing everything, not explaining how he got the measures and just saying "I did this by trial an error". I've been in 2 bestseller Web Dev Courses and many other courses in Udemy and this is the only course where I find myself constantly going back to try catching up what the instructor did, he does it sometimes so fast and moves to another window that its even difficult to pause the video at the exact moment he did a change. He assumes that you are a pro coder since he is going fast, and the requirements say basic understanding of CSS, not senior level speed.

Beware of this course since I've noticed most people left a good review on the early stages of the course where by the way he has a lot of self promotion and you lose time hearing why the course is great, I think this is a trap to make people select 5 stars for the course.

Overall is a good course where you can learn many things, but don't expect a well-experienced instructor, I can tell he is just a pro coder that wants to do good but he is not a professional on educating people.

I base this review on the experiences I had with other instructors in other related fields within Udemy.com

I know the instructor will reply saying that only 0.2% of the students are complaining about the speed, but I would like to see statistics on how many of them gave you a good review before lecture 23 and how many of those did actually finished the course.

However the course is good, the instructor has a really good heart and willing to really help you, I learned many tricks that I don't see in other courses so just be aware the course goes in a fast phase.

Thank you.

response.content:
Woah, Gaming.

This is my very first time I receive this kind of feedback for my course. I am very surprised so I'm guessing that its either a competitor of mine or some kind of a misunderstanding.

I would kindly ask you to specify what you dislike about the presentation style and specify what you dislike about the course.

Its important to state this because your review might be misleading to other students who want to purchase the course.

Thank you for your review.

results.content:
A good course to work on a responsive website and the instructor is good and easy to understand.

The workflow is very good but there are two problems:

- The website could be more realistic. No lipsum and other useless things. A real project with a realistic idea like a website for a restaurant, a bank...

- You will not learn some JavaScript but jQuery, which is a library of JavaScript for web developers. I don't understand how the instructor doesn't know this, because $("...") = jQuery!
results.content_html:
A good course to work on a responsive website and the instructor is good and easy to understand.

The workflow is very good but there are two problems:

- The website could be more realistic. No lipsum and other useless things. A real project with a realistic idea like a website for a restaurant, a bank...

- You will not learn some JavaScript but jQuery, which is a library of JavaScript for web developers. I don't understand how the instructor doesn't know this, because $("...") = jQuery!
